channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #81 - YAPC::EU in Kiev, Perl Workshops in The Netherlands and in Poland
item.description:
The Perl Weekly is now a 'Media Partner' of YAPC::EU, which is going to take place in Kiev in August 2013. This means you'll see me mention it a couple of times as they announce important milestones. Before YAPC::EU, there are going to be 5 Perl Workshops and YAPC::NA as well. The Workshops I have not mentioned yet are the Dutch Perl Workshop on April 19 in Arnhem and the Polish Perl Workshop in Warsaw on 25-26 May. If you are nearby, make sure you attend these events.

In other new, let's welcome MediaMath, the first sponsor of the Perl Weekly!

item.title: MediaMath is hiring Perl Developers: Are you tired of Perl 'scripting'?
item.description: Come join an innovative talented engineering department where you can do some serious Perl programming in a great development environment with clean codebase that is not slapped together. If interested in learning more please contact Marc Spinowitz, Recruiter at MediaMath at mspinowitz@mediamath.com or 646-532-5914

item.title: Play Perl is online
item.description: What is that? I think it is a 'Quest based cooperative self-motivator'. Vyacheslav Matyukhin, the author, writes that it is a 'gamified platform for connecting and encouraging people'.

item.title: Dezi 0.2.8 released
item.description: Dezi is a search platform based on Swish3, Apache Lucy, OpenSearch and Plack.

item.title: The great new Email::Sender
item.description: RJBS released a new release of the module after converting it from Moose to Moo and saving 80% of the run-time for the test suite. The post comes with explanation how can you configure it to make it super easy to test your e-mail sending application, without actually sending the e-mails.

item.title: German Perl-Workshop 2013 - Call for Participation
item.description: The Workshop itself is going to be on 13-15 March, in Berlin.

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop - Damian on Board
Perl Books
item.description: Dave Cross has been active on the biggest Perl group on LinkedIN and once in a while he explains what issues he notices. This time he is shocked by the books people recommend on the LinkedIN forum.

item.title: Adventures in Benchmarking, Part 1
item.description: Everyone wants it faster. David Golden shows how to make it faster and how to measure it.

item.title: Tapper @ FLOSS-weekly
item.description: The authors the Tapper, the test infrastructure were invited by Randal Schwartz to the FLOSS-weekly. See the interview.

item.title: I <3 play-perl
item.description: If the above descriptions did not help, then try how David Mertens explains Play Perl.

item.description: After a long break a new challenge from brian d foy!

item.title: How to create a Perl Module for code reuse
item.description: Creating a package, exporting a few functions. It is not magic and knowing this can be a huge step towards maintainable code.
